data:
PARTICIPANTS
Project’s participants: vocational training last course students of the cook–waiter profession.
The project will be implemented in 2015 06 01–2016 06 01. There will be total four internships to Malta, Germany, United Kingdom and Italy. Total number of participants: 32 (8 to each internship) and 4 accompanying people.

PARTNERS
Consortium: Kaisiadorys School of Business and Technology (coordinator), Elektrenai Vocational Training Centre, Aukstadvaris Agricultural School, Visaginas Vocational Training Centre of Business and Technology.
Hosting organizations: IZI Ltd. (Malta), Austausch und Weiterbildung Agentur AWA (Germany), International Mobility Travel Limited IMT (United Kingdom), AMFI Agenzia per la Mobilità e la Formazione Internazionale (Italy).

OBJECTIVES
Project’s main goal: to improve vocational skills, specific professional and main common competences of cook–waiter profession students, to increase their entrepreneurship and initiative skills.

Other objectives:
1. to educate specific professional competences of the participants;
•to be able to prepare meals containing fish or seafood, be able to serve tables for fish or seafood dishes (in Malta)
•to be able to prepare traditional Italian dishes, be able to serve them to table (in Italy)
•to be able to prepare hot meat dishes, be able to decorate and serve table for hot meat dishes (in Germany)
•to be able to prepare breakfast meals, serve customers during the breakfast (in United Kingdom)
2. to raise the level of participants’ main competences and skills, especially taking into consideration their correspondence to catering sector and labour market;
3. to encourage participants’ entrepreneurship in the field of food preparation and serving, to educate abilities to work in business environment and critical situations, to increase initiative skills and self-sufficiency;
4. to raise the level of participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures, sociability and tolerance;
5. to improve participants’ foreign language skills.

Project will correspond to 2015 KA1 objectives of professional education:
1. to increase recognition of learning outcomes: ECVET and Europass will be used;
2. to encourage entrepreneurs and social partners participation, develop real work place training: internships will be implemented in real work places, social partners are involved in the project.

REQUIREMENTS
1. to acquire specific professional competences;
2. to raise the level of main professional skills and competences, especially taking into consideration their correspondence to catering sector and labour market;
3. to acquire better occupation and employment opportunities, improve perspectives of future career;
4. to acquire entrepreneurship skills in catering sector, to acquire skills how to work in business environment, how to act in critical situations, to increase initiative skills and self-sufficiency.
5. to introduce with business organizing, activities schedule making, work culture;

IMPACT
Project’s main impact: improved vocational skills, specific professional and main common competences of cook–waiter profession students, increased their entrepreneurship and initiative skills. Project’s long lasting impact for participants: successfully passed qualification examination, acquired better employment and future career opportunities. Project’s impact and succession will be integrated into consortium every day operation, new projects preparation.

EXPECTED RESULTS
•Completed professional training under the internship program
•Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates–Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and project’s coordinator
•Professional competences, acquired during the internship, are evaluated by ECVET
•Made reports of internships
•Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements
•In a real work places improved main practical skills of participants giving better integration possibilities in labour markets
•Improved language skills of participants
•Raised level of participants’ self-confidence, self-esteem, initiative skills, entrepreneurship, sociability as well as tolerance and cultural awareness

EVALUATION DOCUMENTS
As the evaluation of acquired and improved skills and competences, every participant will acquire:
•Europass
•Certificate of hosting organizations
•Certificate of coordinating organization

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination will be addressed to present and future students of consortium organizations, their parents, teachers and schools’ communities; entrepreneurs, youth, local authorities and society of Kaisiadorys, Elektrenai, Trakai, Visaginas and surrounding districts; potential trainees of hosting organisations.

Methods of project’s dissemination: articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, stands and booklets about project, presentations of the internships.
Verslumas ir patirtis realiose darbo vietose

PROJECT’S PARTICIPANTS – vocational training last course students of vehicles’ business employee and small business services provider professions.PARTICIPATING ORGANISATIONS:1. Aukštadvaris Agricultural School (project‘s coordinator), AŽŪM2. Šilutė Agricultural School, ŠŽŪM3. Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre, EPMC4. Visaginas Vocational training Centre of Business and Technology, VTVPMC5. International Mobility Travel Limited (United Kingdom)6. IZI Ltd. (Malta)7. Austausch und Weiterbildung Agentur AWA (Germany)8. AMFI Agenzia per la Mobilità e la Formazione Internazionale (Italy)PROJECT’S MAIN GOAL: provide small business services provider and vehicles’ maintenance business employee professions students with practical vocational knowledge and skills, improve their competitiveness and entrepreneurship.OTHER OBJECTIVES1. to educate the following specific professional competences of participants;• for vehicles’ maintenance business employee professions students:-to be able to maintain chassis and transmissions of German-made cars (in Germany)-to be able to maintain chassis and steering systems of right-side steering model cars’ (in United Kingdom);• for small business services provider professions students:-to be able to coordinate different activities in company, to know business organization peculiarities (in Italy)-to be able to organize development of small business for tourists and recreation, communicate with clients (in malta)2. to acquire better occupation and employment opportunities, improve perspectives of future career;3. to raise the level of participants’ self-confidence, self-esteem and sociability, to educate participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures, tolerance;4. to improve participants’ foreign language and communicative skills;5. to acquire entrepreneurship skills, increase initiative skills and innovation.IMPACTParticipants will acquire specific professional competences, improve and deepen practical vocational skills. International practice in companies will enhance participants’ European dimension and tolerance, participants will acquire entrepreneurship, innovative and initiative skills. Long-lasting impact for participants: successfully passed qualifying examination, improved employability opportunities.Participating organizations will raise the level of international collaboration between educational institutions, improve process of vocational training. Organizations’ staff will improve organizational and international management skills, get familiar with good practices and work methods of the partners.Projects long-lasting impact will be assured by projects dissemination, recognition documents. Projects impact and succession will be implemented by applying for new projects in the future, projects results will be integrated in participating organisations daily life.PROJECTS WORK ACTIVITIES• Preparation and signing of grant agreement;• Participants information activities and selection;• Preparation of participants;• Final adjustment of internships’ programs;• Organisation of internships;• Signing agreements with partners and participants;• Implementation of internships;• Participants reports and questionnaire filling;• Presentations of internships, certification;• Dissemination;• Preparation of final report.EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS• Completed professional training under the internship program;• Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates – Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and project’s coordinator. Professional competences, acquired during the internship, are evaluated by ECVET.• Made reports of internships;• Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements;• Improved participants’ vocational skills, giving better employability opportunities in labour market;• Raised level of participants’ self-confidence, innovative and initiative skills, entrepreneurship, sociability as well as tolerance and cultural awareness;• Improved language and communication skills of participants;DISSEMINATIONProject’s dissemination will be addressed to:• entrepreneurs, youth, local authorities and society of Trakai (Aukstadvaris city is situated in Trakai district), Silute, Elektrenai, Visaginas and surrounding districts;• present and future students of AŽŪM, EPMC, ŠŽŪM ir VTVPMC, their parents, teachers and school’s community;• potential trainees of hosting organizations.Methods of project’s dissemination: articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, stands and booklets about project, presentations of the internships and consideration of project’s results.PROJECT’S DURATION2015 06 01 – 2016 06 01, total 12 months. There will be four internships: to Germany. United Kingdom, Italy and Malta. Total number of participants – 32 (plus 4 accompanying people).

PROJECT’S PARTICIPANTS– vocational training second-third course students of builder – constructions finisher, interior decorator and electro-technician professions.

PROJECT’S DURATION
2015 06 01 – 2016 06 01, total 12 months. There will be three internships: to Germany. United Kingdom and Malta. Total number of participants – 24 (8 to each internship).

CONSORCIUM COMPOSITION: Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre (EPMC, coordinator), Kaišiadorys School of Business and Technology (KTVM), Visaginas Vocational Training Centre of Business and Technology (VTVPMC).

PROJECT’S PARTNERS
1. Austausch und Weiterbildung Agentur (Germany)
2. International Mobility Travel (United Kingdom)
3. IZI Ltd. (Malta)

PROJECT’S MAIN GOAL
To educate and improve practical skills, specific vocational competences and self-reliance of builders-constructions finishers, interior decorators and electro-technicians in real workplaces, trying to achieve better work quality and integration to labour market.

OTHER OBJECTIVES
1. to educate the following specific professional competences of participants;
1.1. for builders – constructions finishers in Germany: to be able to renovate exterior buildings’ walls and do restoration works; to be able to do interior renovation and conservation works, to know methods of restoration.
1.2. for interior decorators in Malta: to know how to use ceramic, stone-made and marble-made bricks in the decoration of interior and exterior; be able to use natural stone in the interior decoration.
1.3. for electro-technicians in United Kingdom: to know how to install and maintain electricity system’s protection against surge and fluctuation of voltage; be able to install electricity installation in areas of high humidity.
2. to educate new general professional competences and improve the ones already acquired in real workplaces, especially taking into consideration their contribution to labour market of today;
3. to raise the level of participants’ self-confidence, self-esteem and sociability, to educate participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures, tolerance;
4. to create the environment, where participants could acquire entrepreneurship and initiative skills, self-sufficiency, abilities to work in business and different situations;
5. to improve participants’ foreign language and communicative skills in foreign environment, team-work abilities.

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
• Completed professional training under the internship program;
• Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates – Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and project’s coordinator. Professional competences, acquired during the internship, are evaluated by ECVET.
• Made reports of internships;
• Organised presentations of the internships;
• Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements;
• In real workplaces improved practical skills of participants giving better integration possibilities into labour markets;
• Improved language and communication skills of participants;
• Raised level of participants’ self-confidence, initiative skills, entrepreneurship, sociability as well as tolerance and cultural awareness;

EVALUATION DOCUMENTS
• Europass mobility document
• Certificate of hosting organization
• Certificate of internship’s recognition by EPMC

IMPACT
Participants will improve and deepen practical skills and acquire specific professional competences. While having practice in companies, participants will acquire entrepreneurship and initiative skills, self-sufficiency and abilities to adjust to labour market in any country. Participants will acquire Europass, which is recognized in whole EU. Specific competences, acquired during the internship, will be recognised by ECVET. While living abroad during the internship, participants will acquire sociability skills, they become more tolerant towards other people, acquire awareness and understanding of other cultures. Participants will improve their foreign language skills, team work abilities, raise the level of self-confidence, self-esteem, feel themselves stronger psychologically before entering labour market.

Participating organizations will raise the level of international collaboration between educational institutions, improve process of vocational training. Organizations’ staff will improve organizational and international management skills, get familiar with good practices and work methods of the partners.

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination will be addressed to entrepreneurs, youth, local authorities and society of Elektrenai, Kaisiadorys, Visaginas and surrounding districts; present and future students of EPMC, KTVM ans VTVPMC, their parents, teachers and school’s community; potential trainees of hosting organizations.
Methods of project’s dissemination: articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, stands and booklets about project, presentations of the internships and consideration of project’s results.

PROJECT’S PARTICIPANTS
1. Aukštadvaris Agricultural School (coordinator)
2. Kaišiadorys School of Business and Technology
3. Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre
4. Austausch und Weiterbildung Agentur AWA (Germany)
5. International Mobility Travel Limited (United Kingdom)
6. IZI Ltd (Malta)
7. APLICAPROPOSTA LDA–Braga Open Mobility (Portugal)

PROJECT’S PARTICIPANTS: vocational training teachers.

PROJECT’S MAIN GOAL: to improve vocational training teachers’ abilities to work with national minorities students, lessons giving and groups’ management skills in classes, where are national minorities students, trying to diminish racism and xenophobia in schools and encourage tolerance.

OTHER OBJECTIVES
• To educate participants’ abilities objectively manage problem situations and solve questions in classes, related to racism, xenophobia and discrimination issues;
• To raise participants’ sociability, cultural awareness, understanding and tolerance, which teachers would be able to impart to students;
• To improve participants’ educational, psychological and communication with students skills, especially teaching national minorities students, trying to achieve better motivation and their learning outcomes;
• To acquire modern vocational training methods individualizing vocational training process, to raise general level of participants’ qualification.

PARTICIPANTS REQUIREMENTS
1. PROFESSIONAL:
• To acquire skills how objectively manage problem situations and solve questions in classes, related to racism, xenophobia and discrimination issues;
• To improve vocational training teachers’ lessons giving and groups’ management skills in classes, where are national minorities students, acquire skills to work with such students;
• To become more sociable and tolerant, improve cultural awareness and understanding, learn how to impart that for students;
• To improve educational, psychological and communication with students skills, especially teaching national minorities students;
• To acquire modern vocational training methods individualizing vocational training process, to raise general level of qualification.

2. INDIVIDUAL:
• To improve foreign language skills;
• To educate communicational skills in foreign environment, broaden cultural outlook and number of professional contacts;
• To get familiar with foreign culture;
• To enhance motivation for improvement.

IMPACT
Main impact of the project: during the lectures observation teachers will improve their abilities to work with national minorities students, lessons giving and groups’ management skills in classes, where are national minorities students, trying to diminish racism and xenophobia in schools and encourage tolerance.

Other impact:
• Project will help to diminish racism and xenophobia cases in schools, create tolerant learning environment and educate intelligent young personalities;
• Project will help to increase the level of international collaboration in educational field, improve learning process;
• For project’s implementation responsible staff will improve organisational and managements skills. Acquired experience will lead to better project’s administration.
• Internships presentations will help to spread participants’ acquired competences among other colleagues.

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
• Completed qualifying internships under the internships’ programs.
• Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates – Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and project’s coordinator.
• Made reports of internships.
• Organised internships’ presentations at Consortium schools.
• Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements.
• Created more tolerant learning environment, diminished level of racism, xenophobia and discrimination at Consortium schools.

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination main goal: to introduce target groups with project’s implementation, its goals, activities and results, encourage tolerance, cultural awareness and understanding of people, reveal European values and positive EU support possibilities.

Methods of project’s dissemination: articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, stands and booklets about project, presentations of the internships and consideration of project’s results.

PROJECT’S DURATION
2015 06 01 – 2016 06 01, total 12 months. There will be four internships: to Germany. United Kingdom, Malta and Portugal. Total number of participants 20.
Fostering Energy Efficiency and BehAvioural Change through ICT

The objectives of the FEEdBACk project are to develop, integrate and trial a wide range of energy focused ICT and behaviour modification applications, that will be used to engage energy users and permit them to understand and change their energy consumption related behaviour in three different built environments (Office/Research Labs, Schools, Domestic smart homes) in three climatic settings (northern Portugal, Mediterranean Spain, and northern Germany). The consortium, from seven EU countries, that has been assembled to deliver FEEdBACk consists of highly experienced research organisations in the energy area; three SMEs that specialise in e-learning digital communication applications targeted at behaviour change and in building energy data gathering and representation to managers and users; and three organisations that own and manage buildings, schools and public and private dwellings, who are committed to lowering and making more sustainable their energy use. The development of this broad spectrum of energy related applications and the utilisation of next generation gamification techniques, tested in such a wide range of built environments has not been attempted before. The outputs from the project will enable accelerated commercialisation, by a wide range of innovative SMEs, within and outside the project consortium, of the tools that will help building owners and stakeholders to understand and reduce their energy consumption. The demonstration of the results of the FEEdBACK project will be valuable for Technical & Market planning for the EU energy industry. The FEEdBACK’s ambition is to enable a wide range of companies to incorporate or integrate elements of the applications and the behaviour change components, thereby making their products more competitive and successful in the EU and on a global scale. This will contribute significantly to achieving important sustainable energy EU objectives.
Making the transition to a reliable, sustainable and competitive energy system (32.04.03.01)
